post.body: I am wondering. My zite currently is seeded by 19 people. Who are you, guys? Are you waiting for me to update my zite (making something new)? Or you just do not bother to delete it from your seeding list since you visited it last time? So what about it? Should I be thinking about my zite I was experimenting long time ago?

ZeroMe bug: I'm following guy who doesn't shown in the following list!
Today I've started following two guys: Balancer73 and Karmide. But only Balancer73 appeared in the following list. Why is that? I mean, following works, when not using "every one" mode I can see posts from both of them, but why is one of them is not in the list?

Fake question: What does "Shut the front door!" mean?
<A> There are at least two different doors in some room, and you've been asked to shut exact door: not back door, not door to the left or right, but exact (front) door. <B> Somebody doesn't like what you are talking about or just the fact that you're talking, so he/she asks you to be quiet. <C> Your fridge is open, it must be closed! <D> While developing some computer program, you need to be sure not to allow unauthorised access.

Temporal troubles: Two computers, zero displays.
I have access to two computers. One is always offline (win32: playing video games, reading texts, watching movies, e.t.c.), other for inet (macos: youtube, zeronet, duckduckgo, ...).
Last two years one display started to show black screen with message "no signal" or "wrong mode" after it heats up a little. Now heat up time is about 80 minutes. In summer it doesn't work at all. In winter it most likely will work little longer. So I used the other display. And at september 6th this year my other display catched something like this: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HQSd4Oupx8M But in my case it is one "black hole" in bottom left corner. And this hole grows slowly.
So look at your display and be happy in case it works more or less.
P.S. 6 hours and "heating up" display still shows the picture. So theory works. Today (and few days before) is very cold weather. So I feel little happier. It is good for me to know I can time to time use a computer.

Linguistic Fun: Doggification and Passive Scientists.
In russian language there is slang word for getting a skill to do something. And this word has basis "dog". Dog - собака [sobaka]. To learn how to effectively do something (to get skill) - насобачиться. Common word for this is like english "to learn" - научиться, but this is not so fun. And when some guy knows something very well, you can say "he ate a dog (on this subject)".
Now about russian scientists, I mean word "scientist", not actual scientists. There is something wrong with that word. In english that is ok, you have science, and guys who do science - scientists. Russian word "ученый" [ucheniy] is in same category as english words "broken", "stollen", "made". It is in "passive" or "victim" form. With most professions it is all right in russian, but for some reason poor scientists sounds like guys who suffered education/learning!

I've made some clean up in my posts on ZeroMe.
Now I have 68k of 329k used on ZeroMe. I think it will be good to say it again. You have a limited space in ZeroMe. And when you reach this limit, any time you try to post a new message or comment, you will get some strange error message (do not remember which now). So deleting your old posts helps. And you can see how much of your space you used by opening your hub page from ZeroHello, "sliding" "zero in circle" (in upper right corner) to the left, and search for line like "IDENTITY ADDRESS (limit used: 68.00kB / 329.00kB)".
And in case you want to see my previous posts I deleted, you always can use my zite (look link at my profile).

Linguistic Fun: Say to drugs "Hi".
In ukrainian language word "No" looks like "Hi" (sounds "ni" or like word  "knee"). There is anti-drug slogan: "скажи наркотикам "Нi!"" - "say to drugs "No!"". But more and more people in Ukraine learn english language and they make fun of this slogan, because ukrainan "No" looks exactly like english "Hi".

Linguistic Fun: Smoking kills.
In russian language word for tuxedo is "смокинг" (smoking). But word "smoking" in english associated with cigarettes... Strange, can't find picture in i-net, so lets use our imagination. I saw (or maybe just imagined it) picture of sign where tuxedo was crossed by red diagonal line and in red circle with text "no smoking". And I am not sure, maybe it is my imagination but here is another picture. Picture of tuxedo with gun with silencer, there is no human on this picture, as if person was invisible, but it was in James Bond pose and text was "Smoking kills!".

Achron experience in real life.
Time to time I start to use some new ideas. I do not know from where they come, it feels like some kind of intuition. Those ideas feel like my own. Then after 3-6 months I read a book, from which those ideas are logically come! Weird, huh? As if I am an achron - person who can communicate with him(her)self through the time.

Linguistic Fun: Switching On/Off.
In russian language word for switching something on is "включить" [wklyuchit'] and word for "to switch off" is "выключить" [wiklyuchit']. 
Basis of this word is "ключ" which is "key" like thing to open a lock on a door. Prefix "в" [w] in many cases means "in/into/on", and for prefix "вы" [wy] it is "out/off". So in russian "switching on" is "on-keying" or "in-keying" and "switching off" is "off-keying" or "out-keying" - imagine you're turning on a automobile with a key. Now you know enough to understand following joke.
Joke: When I switch computer off, I go to menu and seek for proper line to click. It says: "выключить...". After I did it many times, I stopped to read carefully, so I started to imagine something that is not there. And now I am consciously kidding by telling myself and people around that option is "выглючить...". One little letter "k" changes to "g" and word "to switch off" transforms into "to stop glitching..." or "to glitch off...". I think this is what it should really mean. You start glitching your computer, you struggle with glitches for some time and then you're glitching your computer off.

Joke: Sharp Shooters.
Some guys decided to show off their shooting skills. They took volunteer (some brave guy), placed an apple on his head and started shooting.
1st guy shoots apple with an arrow by bow and says: "I'm Robin Hood!". All applaude, somebody puts a new apple at volunteer's head.
2nd guy shoots apple with a bullet by his hand gun with silencer saying "I'm Bond... James Bond!". All applaude. Here goes another apple.
3rd guy shoots with a bow and misses the apple! Volunteer goes to hospital with arrow in his eye (I, as storyteller, am not blood thirsty today, so lets say in this ideal universe guy will be o.k.). All shocked. 3rd guy confused and says neurotically: "I am... I am... I am Sorry... Very Sorry!".

How do I make and update my zite(s).
.1. At (Hello ZeroNet_) I click (3 vertical dots), then (Create new, empty site).
.2. Using (File manager) I go to folder/directory in [bla-bla-bla]\ZeroNet\Data\\\[bunch_of_symbols_addressing_my_zite].
.3. Delete all files there!
.4. Copy files of my zite from folder where I "develop" them. (I presume main file is index.html).
.5. Press "sign" button. Make sure content.json file has been created.
.6. Press "publish" button. Experience error "publish failed because of closed port 12345 bla-bla". It looks like this error means "there is no peers yet".
.7. Ask some friend to observe error on his side "no peers, fail to load your site, content.json is missing or something... bla-bla".
.8. Press "publish" button again.
.9. Hopefully you get something like "content published to 6/6 peers".
- - -
To update my zite I do same thing but without Line .1.

Overthinking: Why do I "hate" watching "translated" movies.
There are dimensions in speech and so called "translators" often ignore them.
Dim.1: "Positive/Negative".
Two guys escape in hurry from some danger. One of them falls. Other waits and asks: "Are you alright?", fallen guy stands up and says "Yes, I am ok". Then they keep running from same danger (it is common pattern in movies). And how f??king russian translators prefer to translate this dialogue? They invert "positive/negative" coordinate into opposite! "Are you not hurt?", and fallen guy answers "No, I am not". Imagine how it bothers me to simultaneously hear on both languages "Yes" and "No". It feels like a lie.
Dim.2: "Confidence/Uncertainty".
Original: "It seems like nobody has been here for years". Translation: "I am sure, nobody was there for years".
Dim.3: "Intelligent/Dumbass Talk".
Original "I relocated my current position via transgressing my material vessel from one point in space/time to another" translates into something like this "I moved my ass here". Idea is this: sentences (with complex scientific words and details) become truncated into talk of some stupid guy with low IQ. And when translation is much shorter than original, they (to hide the fact the translation is suck) add something that means nothing to the end of sentence, like "we think so" or "you can be sure of that" or just saying same thing twice.
Dim.4: "(Choice or Possibility)/(Obligation or Indebtedness).
Original: "I want to bla-bla..." transforms into "I must...".
Dim.5: "Cause/Victim".
As persona talks you can figure out it position itself as cause (takes responsibility of his/her action) or as a victim (always blame others, claim things happens to it). F??king stupid russian "translators" invert this dimension.
Dim.6: "Statement/Questions".
Original guy makes a statement like "Look at my gun in my hand!". Translator creates question out of nowhere "Can you see gun in my hand?".
There are many other dimensions that can be described very easily, I just not in the mood to recall them all for now. And I think you understand my main idea.
P.S. I understand there are things that is hard to translate, but that is not the case. Russian stupid translators do not bother to translate correctly even in cases it can be done easily.

Joke: Pythagorean Theorem Proof.

One of students: "You do not have to proof anything, we believe you!".

Joke: Ants and Elephants.
Ants are sitting in bushes and planning to hunt an elephant. Ant leader says to his gang: "Main and hardest thing is to knock it down, then we can trample it easily".

Joke: Such a loser.
He was such a loser. He failed to finish almost anything he planned to do. So he decided to put an end to this by committing suicide by shooting himself with a gun. And guess what? He missed! What a loser...

Joke: Pulling the cat by its rubber into long box.
In russian language there a some idioms to express situation when you need to get something done, but you do not want to do it right now, so you're making excuses to do it later (tomorrow, next week, next month,...), in other words you're delaying some work. And instead of word "delaying" you can use one of following idioms:
.1. "To pull the cat by its tale". Imagine, you need to relocate one cat (which symbolises work to be done), but instead of doing it properly, you're pulling cat's tale, so cat yells and clings to a carpet (work is not done).
.2. "To stretch a rubber". Same thing, you're stretching the elastic... something elastic. And when you stop, this elastic something shrinks to original size, symbolising your futile efforts.
.3. "To stock something into long box". Imagine archive room with long boxes, you can pull one of those long boxes and see paper files inside sorted in alphabetical order. There are many of those, and you've pulled long box for things with letter "C". You put something into your archive with many previously "delayed" things to do. That means, you most likely will forget it soon, and work will not be completed ever.
And of cause you can use those 3 idioms simultaneously to tell someone strictly: "Do not pull the cat by it's rubber into long box!".

comment.body: Link, please!
I was hoping for something I can download and listen with my pocket player. But thank you anyway.

Here is example of podcast I listen regularly: https://radio-t.com/ It is russian podcast so it may be useless for you, but what I want to say - it is easy to download mp3 from sites like that one. And when site hides "download possibility" or tries to feed me "some bullsh*t" I just prefer to seek for other things to do. :-]
@Talnicrom: Try to unfollow me, please. And tell me does this work for you. If it works, you can follow me again if you want. Oh, sorry, I confused you for guy who follows me.
Anyone who follows me, please, try to unfollow me and tell me does it work for you or not.

I do not know what facebook is, and I do not want to know what is it (a can guess it is something like ZeroMe). And with ZeroNet you do not have to! Pink Floyd "The Wall" says: "we don't need no force control. Teachers, leave us kids alone!". :-]

Try this sequence:
1. Create a Test post.
2. Do a pixel hunting between picture representing you (your awatar) and your post.
3. Find pencil symbol which should appear and click it.
4. Then options "cancel/delete/save" should appear.
5. Use "delete"!
Did anybody try it already? From my point of view nothing is happening.
Oh, it looks like this new features are filters which are individual for every user. So it is not like "like"s or "antilike"s.
@Talnicrom: This is great! Now we can "like" comments here.

@Talnicrom: About messages which are marked as spam or ugly by guys I follow. I do not know is this a good idea. I think for start/test it can be nice to have some indication... I mean it is good to see some warning sign that one of your friends marked this post as a spam or it is ugly rather than hide this post.
Imagine what can happen if someone throw his poodle out of house and it will become wild. Wild Dire Poodle (not cute anymore). Scary.

Magnet link is just little string (bunch of text symbols). Something that begins like "magnet:?xt=urn:bla-bla-bla-bla-bla..." and ends before next "=" symbol. How it possibly can not work? You just need to copypaste text to your torrent client. I hope this will help you.

@Dergatt: Yes, that is annoying. I mean, when you searching for something and you find at last some (download link)/(magnet link)/(torrent)... and it doesn't work! Sad thing. It is "pointers and objects" thing (pointers are not objects they point to), or it is "map and territory" thing, or... I am short of analogies. Oh, here is good analogy: it is like someone tell you there is an apple on a table, you check the table, but there is no apple for some reason. Annoying.

And I got audiobook "Wisdom of Psychopaths". One big 400Mb mp3 file. I've splitted it into 10 parts 50 minutes each wav, made them loud, encoded into mp3 again and load them into my "pocket" mp3 player. This made me happier for a while. What a joke: psychopath needs to split something into pieces!

@meidan: here is a magnet link for audiobook "Wisdom of Psychopaths" after my manipulations: magnet:?xt=urn:btih:96095659B476046B19EA3AFA0A028FC1052EB88A&dn=__wisdom_of_psychopaths It is new way for me to share files, so I am not sure if it works or not. I will be glad to know if you successfully download mp3s. Hash is: 96095659b476046b19ea3afa0a028fc1052eb88a Wait a minute, it looks like hash of a torrent is part of magnet link of a torrent.

@meidan: I am seeding now, but it looks like nobody downloading. I will be online for about 2 hours from now... After 2 hours nothing happens. I am about to go offline. Next time I will try to ask people to download this torrent. Maybe I am not understand how it works and made some mistake.
@Voruman: how about this one? magnet:?xt=urn:btih:96095659B476046B19EA3AFA0A028FC1052EB88A&dn
Or simply using hash: 96095659B476046B19EA3AFA0A028FC1052EB88A
Oh, It looks like someone managed to download! Is that you, Voruman?
@Voruman: strange, I think I start to understand you without translator. Jes looks like Yes, laboras looks like labour (hard work). So hash works, and my magnet link doesn't. Thanks, it helps a lot.

@meidan: Voruman managed to download this torrent using hash. And it looks like something wrong with my understanding of magnet link, so magnet link doesn't work. Try to use hash: 96095659b476046b19ea3afa0a028fc1052eb88a

@Voruman: is that so? All you need to fix my magnet link to make it work is change all capital/big letters into noncapital/small letters? I will check this hypothesis next time I try to send something via magnet link. It is very funny! :-]

@meidan: Voruman says this link works: magnet:?xt=urn:btih:96095659b476046b19ea3afa0a028fc1052eb88a&dn=__wisdom_of_psychopaths It is strange and funny, but all I need to fix magnet link to make it work is "decapitalize" big letters into small ones.

@meidan: I love very much movies where time travel is involved. Here is example: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UTO0ogdNMdY It lasts less than 20 minutes, but it is worthy time travel movie. Here is list of time travel movies I am using: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_time_travel_works_of_fiction be careful not to mess movies list with book list - they both on the same page. Strange, I can't find movie "Paradox" 2016, maybe because it is new movie. It is nice time travel movie. .1. At question "what time is it?" I automatically add "by summer time" at the end of my answer.
.2. You need to be aware of summer or winter time it is now outside anytime you make appointment with other people, so before you talking somebody to make meeting at specific time, be sure you both in same "time zone".

This model uses only 2 grades of power: it is within your power or it is not within your power. I find more useful model which uses 3 grades of power: red, yellow, green. I do not know other sources, there fore I think I am invented it (and it will be some fun for me if you give me a link someone described this model more accurately). So here it is: all you can or can not do you can place in 3 different zones: 1. Green. You can do it easily. You have enough resources (skills, knowledge, time, energy, proper mood, e.t.c.). 2. Yellow. You can do it, but... it may cost you very much: you must work hard, make research, investigate; overspend time, energy. And you never know will you succeed or not. 3. Red zone. It is like yellow zone, but extreme. You have less chances of success, you need to waste almost all your efforts, and you can damage your health or mind for nothing. Very dangerous.
Here is exampls: eating piece of cake is piece of cake - easy, you can do it, you did it before lots of times - green zone; breaking wall using your head as a ram - red zone - you probably will not break the wall, but you can be disappointed and have your health damaged, or even die trying. For some guy breaking wall with his head may be in green zone - he is a trained ninja, monk or something, but I guess for most of us it is in red zone. Problem is you never can be sure about is it possible or is it impossible, but it is useful to think about things as they are in red zone... for now at least. More powerful you become, more things shifts into your green zone, and some things can even shift from red into yellow zone.

@Dergatt: @Durand: I want to share with you my definition of word "own". If something truly is your own it means you can do anything with it: share it with your friends/enemies, multiply/duplicate it, destroy it (if you don't like it anymore), study it's contents (reverse engineering), anything you can imagine you can do if you truly own something. Thing is you do not truly own anything. It is more like you loan it: I mean someone else own this thing and you just loan it and this someone else dictate you rules (you can do that, and you can't do that). Very big "red flag" you loaning something instead of owning thing is you have to pay every month/year/day for "owning" that thing. It is not owning it is loaning. And same thing is about legal-illegal concept. What is legal or illegal? Someone powerful dictates his will: he do not like some things you might do and names those deeds "illegal", he wants you to do things specific way - that he calls "legal". Joke: soon it can become illegal just refuse to be stupid! You doing something and you do not pay for it because you smart enough to find your own ways - you criminal! Example: you learned illegally how to read, so you do not have to pay some specialist to read books for you - it is illegal, you are criminal! You can grow your own food, so you do not have to pay for food - you are criminal! Jeez, all this "copyright" thing is totally bullshit of men in power to make other people stupid because it is profitable. And one last question: when you pay for some "legal" thing, where goes you money, wha? Do you really think you support guys who create something. Most money goes to powerful people who use those guys who create.

.1. What do you want exactly? And who stops you from doing it?
.2. Words "freedom", "force", "oppressor" are empty structures. They make no sense unless someone fills them with his/her own experience. Imagine you are movie director. You can't just capture "freedom" on your video camera. To make movie "We fight for our freedom" you can make scenario where some "bad" guys locked some "good" friends in some dungeon inside some castle. "Bad" guys torture poor "good" guys. And other "good" people preparing and then executing assault of that castle, killing "bad" guys and rescue "good" guys. You can call that "Freedom", but this is one of those things that exists in your head only! There can be "good" guys, "bad" guys that involved in some activity (they do specific things), but in reality out there, there is no such "thing" as "freedom", it is imaginary.
.3. With my own associations with your spectrum I more like to "do nothing". If someone successfuly stops me from doing one thing I want to do, then I most likely choose to do something else (from my list of things I want to do) to make this "oppressor" to do more hard work to stop me this time. Or I can seek for other ways to do same thing. And I prefer to detect how I support "oppressor" and at same time not aware of it. Best way to deal with oppressor is to stop feeding it. Eventually it will lose it's power and cease to exist.

@Militaryriotlab: Words are like variables in programming languages. If you use variable without filling it with some exact value, it will not work. Let me try fill those variables, but your teacher can have other meanings. Lets guess that "Law" is just list of "rules" - list of thing you can do and things you can avoid to do for being "good" guy for all people who agreed with this "Law". Word "by" used to show that someone is cause of some activity, so "rule by law" means "law is ruling (people)", so word "rule" is verb in this case. Word "of" used to connect two nouns, so "rule of law" means "law has this rule", so word "rule" is noun here.

@Militaryriotlab: here is another idea: word "by" is much stronger than word "of". It is like "I am sure" is much stronger than "I think". "Book written by Flyman" is very strong, it means exactly that Flyman is one who wrote this book. And "book of Flyman" is not so specific, you know that "book" somehow related to "Flyman" but you can't tell how: maybe Flyman wrote this book, maybe someone else wrote this book about Flyman, maybe Flyman likes this book, maybe Flyman mentioned this book, maybe Flyman has this book, e.t.c. So "rule by law" can mean "this rule is for sure caused by law", and "rule of law" can mean "this rule somehow related to law".

Truth is level of something's/someone's synchronization with reality ("which one?" is a good question).
Reason is a fake. You can make any reason for anything. For example "pink elephants fly to the south during a winter" because "south has more warm climate". You can give me **anything** and I will create **logical** reason for that! There is reason vs purpose thing. You can easily create reason why something happening, but what is funny, it is some times very difficult to figure out purpose or "what for" for anything. Simply reason is excuse and located in the past on timeline, and purpose is target in the future (something someone wants to achieve). So purpose of life needs some master-slave relationship. If you are slave and have a master, then you have a purpose of your live. So question "what is purpose of my life" can be transformed into "who is my master?".
